p:
The two-way ANOVA (Group X Task) revealed a main effect for Task, F(1, 134) = 336.51, p < 0.01, ƞ 2
p = 0.72. The mean RT in the choice-RT task (373.39 ± 57.13 ms) was shorter than the mean RT in the Simon task (473.02 ± 60.10 ms). There was no main effect for Group, F(2, 134) = 0.32, p = 0.73, ƞ 2
p = 0.01. The mean RTs for the external focus group, the internal focus group, and the control group were 423.00 ± 45.02, 419.12 ± 52.52, and 427.39 ± 50.93 ms, respectively. Finally, there was no interaction, F(2, 134) = 0.14, p = 0.87, ƞ 2
p = 0.00. Mean RTs for the choice RT task and the Simon task, respectively, were: for the external focus group – 375.05 ± 55.70 and 470.96 ± 51.72 ms; for the internal focus group – 369.19 ± 48.94 and 469.05 ± 66.80 ms; for the control group – 375.94 ± 66.19 and 478.84 ± 61.30 ms.
